results.title: RMIT AIM Collection 1993
results.brief_description:
Compilation of student work from the University of RMIT Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) Department. 1993.
The Centre for Animation and Interactive Media, its courses, facilities, staff and collection of work was transferred from Swinburne University of Technology to RMIT University in 1995.

results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio

results.title: Sunshine and shadow
results.creator_credit: Lisa Ades, Ric Burns, New York Historical Society, Steeplechase Films, Thirteen, WGBH (Boston) and WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “New York: a documentary film”.
Episode 3: SUNSHINE AND SHADOW (1865-1898) charts New York’s history during the decades following the Civil War when it continued to grow demographically, geographically and financially at a staggering rate. It explores the incomparable fortunes of the robber barons at the unabashed corruption of political leaders in an era when the expansion of both wealth and poverty- and the schism between them- built to a complex. The episode ends with the consolidation of the five boroughs to form Greater New York on January 1, 1898. Narrated by David Ogden Stiers.

results.title: The XPT East Coast journey
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Great train journeys of Australia”.
On the Express Passenger Train- Australia’s fastest train, travel from Brisbane in subtropical Queensland to cosmopolitan Sydney in the heart of New South Wales. Cross the rugged Macpherson ranges, tour Australia’s economic heartland and visit the country’s pristine beaches. The XPT even cruises through some alternative villages and through Australia’s spectacular rainforests. As the train pulls into one of its 21 stops, Coff’s Harbour, view the vast plantations of bananas as well as the gaudy “Big Banana” tourist park, which symbolizes the recent tourism boom. Finally, the XPT reaches Sydney. Hugging the shores of a magnificent harbor and accented by its elegant bridge, Sydney is the quintessential icon of the Australian experience.

results.title: Australian made
results.creator_credit: Richard Lowenstein, Jill Bilcock, John McLean, Captured Live Productions and Tom Hegarty Productions
results.brief_description: Australian music came of age in the summer of 1987 when the cream of Oz rock swept the continent for the most ambitious series of open air concerts ever staged beneath the Southern Cross. Almost 140,000 fans in six cities were entertained with a diverse array of potent and imaginative rock - from understated avant-garde to tempestuous thunder from Down Under. The dynamic performances and behind-the-scenes activity of the tour has generated an exciting, fast paced and imaginative feature film. Includes performances by: INXS ; Jimmy Barnes ; The Triffids ; I’m Talking ; The Saints ; The Divinyls and The Models.

results.title: Kakadu
results.creator_credit: Brian Hannant, Bob Lagettie, Norm Wilkinson and Chateau Productions
results.brief_description: This is a well-made documentary about Kakadu National Park, with beautiful photography of the amazing landscape. Narrated by Jack Thompson, the film gives a fascinating account of the natural history of the area, including the flora and fauna, as well as the Aboriginal history Of equal interest, the film discusses the history of the Park, which was created at the same time as the adjacent Ranger Nuclear Mine began construction. Kakadu is rich in natural wonders, in Aboriginal history and, on the other hand, in mineral resources attractive to mining companies, which makes it one of the world’s unique sites.

results.title: Tweekage
results.brief_description: Skateboard enthusiasts will enjoy this hour of footage recording some of Australia’s top skaters performing impressive moves; kick flipping, sliding and grinding across Sydney, Melbourne, the Gold Coast and major skating events. For those of you who don’t skate you may be inspired to give it a try, although the SLAM section illustrates that even professionals are prone to hurting themselves. Good camera work puts the viewer right into the heart of the action and provides an adrenaline rush.

results.title: 1993 World solar challenge
results.creator_credit: Don Scutt, GMH and Monash University. Mechanical Engineering, Caulfield
results.brief_description: Covers the 1993 Daido Hoxan World Solar Challenge, a race by solar powered cars from Darwin to Adelaide over 3000 kilometres. Includes interviews with the leading teams and technical experts.

results.title: Bayi Gardiya (Singing Desert)
results.credit_line:
Creative technology studio: Nakatomi
Performed by Christian Thompson
Composed by Christian Thompson and Mark Mitchell
Sound production by Mark Mitchell at Electric Dreams Studio
With special thanks to Rachael Sheridan, Jeanette Little and Leyla Varela
results.material_description: 360 degree video, VR system, headphones, sand and AIATSIS map of Indigenous Australia
results.brief_description:
Bayi Gardiya (Singing Desert) is an immersive, 360 degree moving image and sound experience.

The environment within Bayi Gardiya situates a visitor in the creek bed of The Sixth Mile, Barcaline, western Queensland. The imagery and sound within transforms from morning to midday and then to twilight and night. These transitions also shift through seasonal change to represent and also comment on the impacts of Global Warming on the fragile, semi-desert Hinterland and country represented in the work.
